intro: Hieracium stipitatum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium stipitatum is often found in moist environments and can form dense colonies, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
